title: MIBiG Submission form
description: Please fill out this form to submit MIBiG-compliant annotation data on a biosynthetic gene cluster.

submitter_name.title: Name of contact for correspondence
submitter_name.description: This person will be the point of contact for any communication related to this entry.

submitter_institution.title: Academic institution or company name
submitter_institution.description: Please use the full, official name of your institute in English. E.g., 'Harvard University'.

mibig_accession.title: MIBiG accession number
mibig_accession.description: This number should start with 'BGC', followed by numbers: e.g., 'BGC0000829'. If you have not received an MIBiG accession number for your gene cluster yet, please request one first before filling out this form.

biosyn_class.title: Biosynthetic class
biosyn_class.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple classes in the case of a hybrid gene cluster. Select all categories that apply: e.g., a polyketide with sugar monomers attached should be both 'Polyketide' and 'Saccharide'.

publications.title: Key publications associated with this gene cluster, pathway or molecule
publications.description: Publications describing experiments on this pathway. Please input PubMed IDs (PMIDs, not PMCIDs!), separated by commas: e.g., '12000953,8843436'. Only enter numeric characters and commas. If a PMID is not available, a DOI can be entered instead (without the designation 'DOI' itself, e.g. '10.1039/c4sc01927j')

loci.title: Gene cluster sequence information
loci.description: Specify the gene cluster sequence as deposited/submitted in/to GenBank (or ENA/DDBJ). If the pathway is split over multiple clusters, add multiple genomic locus entries below. The genome or gene cluster sequence must be submitted to GenBank/ENA/DDBJ (and an accession number must be received) before this form can be filled out.

Accession.title: GenBank nucleotide accession number
Accession.description: E.g., AL645882. Only use GenBank accessions, not RefSeq accessions or GI numbers.

mixs_compliant.description: Whether the GBK/EMBL/DDBJ is annotated with metadata according to the MIxS standard (Yilmaz et al. Nat Biotechnol 29: 415–420). If unknown, leave unticked.

start_coord.title: Start coordinate
start_coord.description: Insert numeric characters only. May be left empty if gene cluster covers entire GenBank nucleotide record.

end_coord.title: End coordinate
end_coord.description: Insert numeric characters only. May be left empty if gene cluster covers entire GenBank nucleotide record.

conn_comp_cluster.title: Evidence of involvement
conn_comp_cluster.description: Type of evidence that shows that this gene cluster is responsible for the biosynthesis of the designated molecules. Hold ctrl or cmd key for multiple selection.
enum: Gene expression correlated with compound production

compounds.title: __ Chemical compound(s)
compounds.description: Add one entry for each molecule produced from this pathway / gene cluster.

chem_synonyms.title: Synonyms for this compound
chem_synonyms.description: Synonyms for the compound, separated by commas.

database_deposited.description: Whether there is an entry for the molecule on PubChem, chEMBL, chEBI or ChemSpider. If there is an entry but this does not contain the correct chemical structure, please do not tick the box to enable you to input updated data.

databases_deposited.title: Database(s) that contain(s) this molecule.
databases_deposited.description: When selecting (multiple) databases, please note that it should concern entries representing exactly the same molecule, with the exact same structure and molecular formula (not a derivative or variant).

pubchem_id.title: PubChem ID
pubchem_id.description: Insert numeric characters only. E.g., '3081434'. Type '0' if not applicable.

chebi_id.title: ChEBI ID
chebi_id.description: Insert numeric characters only. E.g., '42355' for 'CHEBI:42355'. Type '0' if not applicable.

chembl_id.title: ChEMBL ID
chembl_id.description: Insert numeric characters only. E.g., '273387' for 'CHEMBL273387'. Type '0' if not applicable.

chemspider_id.title: ChemSpider ID
chemspider_id.description: Insert numeric characters only. E.g., '12041'. Type '0' if not applicable.

chem_struct.title: Compound structure
chem_struct.description: Mandatory for all structurally characterized compounds except for large ones such as most RiPPs and polysaccharides. Chemical structure entered as SMILES string, preferentially isomeric. This can be easily acquired with standard software such as ChemDraw, by, e.g., choosing 'Copy as SMILES'.

mol_mass.title: Exact molecular mass
mol_mass.description: Monoisotopic m/z of the molecule for the below specified ion type. Use a dot as a decimal point, not a comma.

evidence_struct.title: Technique(s) used to elucidate/verify the structure
evidence_struct.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple items.

chem_act.title: Molecular activities
chem_act.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple items. Enter only proven activities; always provide the publication IDs where the evidence was provided under 'Key publications' above.

chem_target.title: Molecular targets
chem_target.description: Enter proteins, RNAs or other (macro)molecules targeted by this compound, separated by commas. Enter only proven targets; always provide the publication IDs where the evidence was provided under 'Key publications' below.

chem_moieties.title: Unusual chemical moieties in this molecule
chem_moieties.description: With 'unusual', it is meant that they are not covered by NRPS/PKS/RiPP/terpene/saccharide biosynthetic mechanisms. Moieties synthesized by a separate PKS like 6-methylsalicylic acid should also be indicated.

moiety_subcluster.title: Sub-cluster involved in the biosynthesis of this moiety
moiety_subcluster.description: Note that a sub-cluster may consist of genes dispersed throughout the gene cluster. Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

operon_genes.title: Genes in operon
operon_genes.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) that make up this operon, exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, from 5' to 3', separated by commas.

lipid_moiety.title: Lipid moiety attached to the peptide

lin_cycl_nrp.description: Also counts as cyclic if the molecule is hybrid and the NRP cyclizes onto another part of the hybrid molecule. Internal cyclizations of an amino acid or cyclizations of two adjacent amino acids or ketide groups do not count to define a cyclic compound: a cyclization should bridge residues that would otherwise not be connected, with at least two other residues being present between them.

nrps_te_type.title: Thioesterase type:
nrps_te_type.description: Also choose 'None' if it concerns a hybrid pathway and the thioesterase is an integral part of a PKS module at the end of the assembly-line.

nrps_thioesterase.title: Thioesterase-encoding gene(s):
nrps_thioesterase.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

pk_subclass.title: Polyketide subclass
pk_subclass.description: Also choose 'Other' if the polyketide is a hybrid of multiple polyketide types.

lin_cycl_pk.description: Also counts as cyclic if the molecule is hybrid and the polyketide cyclizes onto another part of the hybrid molecule. Internal cyclizations of an amino acid or cyclizations of two adjacent amino acids or ketide groups do not count to define a cyclic compound: a cyclization should bridge residues that would otherwise not be connected, with at least two other residues being present between them.

pks_subclass.title: Polyketide synthase subclass
pks_subclass.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple items. The 'Modular Type I' option denotes the presence of cis-AT modules. If the pathway is a hybrid NRPS-PKS pathway, select the type of PKS responsible for the polyketide-synthesizing part of the pathway.

pks_genes.title: Genes in cluster encoding nonmodular polyketide synthases / ketosynthases
pks_genes.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas. For Type II PKSs, do not include chain length factor-encoding genes.

pufa_mod_doms.title: Nonreductive scaffold-modifying domain in this synthase
pufa_mod_doms.description: Any additional modifications made by a domain within this PUFA synthase

nr_iterations.title: Number of chain synthesis iterations performed by iterative PKS module

iter_cycl_type.title: Iterative PKS cyclization type
iter_cycl_type.description: Cyclization type according to Zhou, Li & Tang, Nat. Prod. Rep., 2010,27, 839-868.

trans_at.title: Genes in cluster encoding trans-acyltransferases
trans_at.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

ketide_length.title: Polyketide length
ketide_length.description: Length of the ketide chain, e.g. 6 for a hexaketide or 9 for a nonaketide.

cyclases.title: Gene(s) in cluster involved in folding and cyclization of the aromatic polyketide
cyclases.description: E.g., cyclases/aromatases. Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

pks_te_type.title: Thioesterase type:
pks_te_type.description: Also choose 'None' if it concerns a hybrid pathway and the thioesterase is an integral part of an NRPS module at the end of the assembly-line.

pks_thioesterase.title: Thioesterase-encoding gene(s):
pks_thioesterase.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

lin_cycl_ripp.description: Internal cyclizations of an amino acid or cyclizations of two adjacent amino acids do not count to define a cyclic compound: a cyclization should bridge residues that would otherwise not be connected.

precursor_loci.title: Genes in cluster encoding RiPP precursor peptides

gene_id.title: Gene ID:
gene_id.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) that make up this operon, exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

core_pept_aa.title: RiPP core peptide amino acid sequence(s)
core_pept_aa.description: Input sequence as single-AA abbreviations, e.g. 'ITSISLCTPGCKTGALMGCNMKTATCHCSIHVSK'. If there are multiple (such as in the case of cyanobactins), separate by commas.

lead_pept_len.title: Length of the leader peptide
lead_pept_len.description: Length in AA, including N-terminal signal if present.

cleavage_recogn_site.title: Amino acid sequence(s) of cleavage recognition site(s), if known. If multiple, separate by commas.

recogn_motif.title: Recognition motif in leader peptide for modification peptide

peptidase.title: Peptidase(s) involved in precursor cleavage
peptidase.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are used in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

AA_pos_1.title: Position of first amino acid involved

AA_pos_2.title: Position of second amino acid involved

terpene_c_len.title: Terpene subclass by number of carbon units

terpene_synth_cycl.title: Genes in cluster encoding terpene synthases/cyclases
terpene_synth_cycl.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

prenyl_transf.title: Genes in cluster encoding prenyltransferases
prenyl_transf.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

gt_genes.title: Genes in cluster encoding glycosyl transferases

gt_gene.title: Gene ID
gt_gene.description: Enter locus tag, protein ID or gene ID (in this order of preference), exactly as it is used in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry.

evidence_gt_spec.title: Evidence
evidence_gt_spec.description: Select the strongest available level of evidence.

sugar_subcluster.title: Sub-cluster for sugar biosynthesis, if within this gene cluster
sugar_subcluster.description: Note that a sub-cluster may consist of genes dispersed throughout the gene cluster. Enter locus tags, gene IDs or protein IDs, separated by commas. A sub-cluster only needs to be declared once, in case there are multiple glycosyltransferases with the same substrate specificity.

comments.title: Please write any final comments regarding Step 1 here.

embargo.description: For newly characterized gene clusters only. You will be sent an accession number that you can mention in the paper. Please notify us upon publication so that the embargo can be lifted.
